title: Business Applications Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
**Employment Type:**
Full time**Shift:**
Day Shift**Description:****POSITION PURPOSE**


Establishes and maintains a consultative partnership with a business area/user clients providing operational functional knowledge supporting the development of new/improved capabilities; translating business requirements to functional requirements, and identifying, defining and developing solutions to application and system problems. Serves as a primary contact and resource, by representing and interpreting client needs to technical staff and ensuring solutions meet overall client business needs and expectations. Possesses a thorough and sound understanding of the business operations and functional area in order to appropriately evaluate and analyze business work flow and recommend alternative approaches in developing process improvement. Work activities require competency in the application supported. Strong communication and facilitation skills are needed to interface with varied interests and audiences, and solid analytical and problem solving skills to effectively develop solutions to application / process issues and maximize application capabilities in order to meet the clients business needs. Incumbents have generally functioned in the capacity of a “super-user.” At this level, the position requires a high degree of independence and is viewed as a trusted resource to clients and other team members. Works with enterprise, regional or local level applications that may be deployed across multiple ministries organizations and geographic locations.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Interfaces with business owners to understand, define and translate business requirements into functional specifications. Serves as a liaison between the client and the technical support staff. Works extensively with the home office business partners.
* Researches and evaluates operational/functional area work-flow, investigates practices, processes and procedures; meets with decision makers and clients to define business requirements. Analyzes current business system issues and develops process improvement and participates in best practice. Provides guidance in the alignment of learning strategies for new projects and process improvement initiatives.
* Works with clients to define business problems/issues and desired outcomes. Develops recommendations on alternative approaches and possible opportunities, while determining impact and long-term viability of solutions.
* Develops and maintains medium complex detailed project plan outlining steps and timetables for completion; conducts process flow mapping and gap analysis; assists with conversion initiatives; cutover preparation and testing; monitors project progress and provides status reports to management and clients. Develops detailed functional specifications and training documentation.
* Facilitates meetings, demos and training sessions with clients either in person or via Centra sessions, e-mail and phone. Works with clients to implement new/upgraded applications. Provides guidance and training to ensure a smooth transition. Provides significant interactive and collaborative partnerships with home office business partners.
* May provide training readiness for specific application implementations. Conducts needs assessment to determine training solutions; designs, modifies, or assists in the development of customized educational programs. Prepares materials, guides, job aides learning modules; conducts training utilizing various delivery methods and techniques.
* Plans, coordinates and monitors testing events. Develops test plans; creates test scripts and facilitate testing involving other TIS team and clients. Develop on-call support materials and job aids. May participate in regression testing and preparing environment for training readiness.
* Monitors and provides support to team members in resolving customer issues and other on-call issues and meeting project deadlines. May mentor other less experienced team members, which may include training, delegating tasks and providing assistance.
* Performs system builds and maintain profiles; conducts master file maintenance; and updates tables. Performs functionality testing of new releases and changes to vendor software applications. Performs file / table audits to ensure integrity.
* Troubleshoots and analyzes moderately complex application functionality issues. Interfaces with technical application staff and/or vendors to resolve system or application problems. Research and respond to customer issues (i.e., break/fix).
* Develops and maintains user client relationships and customer service in order to support customer business needs.
* Knows, understands, incorporates and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision and Values in leadership behaviors, practices and decisions.
* Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health Corporate Integrity Program, Code of Ethics, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor's degree in healthcare or information technology and a minimum of three-five (3-5) years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Intermediate proficiency (3-5 yrs) with Windows based applications. Knowledge and experience with instructional design/development authoring tools and data structures preferred.
* Reasonable knowledge and experience (3-5 yrs) utilizing healthcare software applications and interfaces preferred. Some understanding of system integration.
* Reasonable operational knowledge and experience (3-5yrs) of health care delivery and supported business processes preferred.
* Strong proficiency utilizing presentation software.
* Prior experience functioning as a “super-user.”
* Ability to meet project deadlines and take on project lead role.
* Ability to interpret regulatory requirements and apply to application.
* Good analytical, technical, problem solving skills and technical aptitude.
* Ability to represent the team in customer and inter-team meetings, present information and provide consultative advice. Ability to effectively lead group sessions and translate technical issues into business terminology.
* Ability to create functional specifications
* Ability to meet deadlines and set priorities.
* Ability to obtain and exchange information.
* Ability to work independently on a day-to-day basis.
* Ability to develop and deliver learning programs for the effective utilization of specific business applications. Knowledge and experience in at least one learning modality specialization, i.e. instructor led, synchronous, e-learning,print, etc. preferred. Knowledge of and experience with adult learning methodology and techniques preferred.
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills. Ability to interface with various internal business analysts, hospital client users and external vendors.
* Good organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Good written and verbal communication skills.
* Must possess a willingness to learn and develop skills.
* Must possess a willingness to work in teams and with direct supervision.
* Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.
* A personal presence which is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals and values of Trinity Health.

**PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS**

* This position operates in a typical office environment. The area is well-lit, temperature-controlled and free from hazards. Incumbent communicates frequently, in person and over the telephone, with people in a number of different locations on technical issues. Manual dexterity is needed in order to operate a keyboard. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communications. The environment in which the incumbent will work requires the ability to concentrate, meet deadlines, work on several projects at the same period and adapt to interruptions.
* The incumbent must be capable of traveling in the course of completing project assignments.
* The incumbent may provide 24X7 on-call rotation support for software application, which includes assisting on applying fixes and resolution to production problems, errors and issues.


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of duties so assigned.

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**

  

Trinity Health is one of the largest not-for-profit, Catholic healthcare systems in the nation. Built on the foundation of our Mission and Core Values, we integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our colleagues have different lived experiences, customs, abilities, and talents. Together, we become our best selves. A diverse and inclusive workforce provides the most accessible and equitable care for those we serve. Trinity Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Unlock the door to operational excellence as a Business Systems Analyst! Join us on a mission to enhance service levels and operational efficiencies through innovative processes and technology changes. As a key player supporting the Assistant Vice President of Operations Support, you'll become a subject matter expert, driving impactful change in system functions. Bring your expertise to the table, collaborating with executives, managing system and process changes, and ensuring seamless daily operations. If you're a tech-savvy professional with a growth mindset and a passion for efficiency, this is your opportunity to make a difference!


Input 1 is a dynamic organization that operates in a rapidly changing environment. The responsibilities associated with the position may change in accordance with the company’s business needs. More specifically, the employee may be required to perform additional and/or different responsibilities from those set forth below.


**$80,000/year - $100,000/year (bi-weekly pay).**


**Position Purpose**


The goal of this position is to assist the Assistant Vice President, Operations Support in identifying, planning and executing plans to improve service levels and operational efficiencies via process or technology change, resolve ad hoc system operational issues, design solutions and produce system, procedural and related documentation and artifacts.


**Essential Job Functions**


* Become a business systems subject matter expert by understanding and staying well-informed of operational procedures and business use-cases for system functions


* Continuously search for and identify opportunities for improvement in efficiencies and/or cost reductions via process or technology change


* Consult or collaborate with executives and managers to develop, implement and manage system and process change throughout operations


* Participate in pre-deployment testing and post-deployment implementation and monitoring of newly developed system features


* Document current and new system processes and workflows


* Support daily operations by resolving timely, accurately, efficiently and completely day-to-day operational system and data issues


* Support new client implementation process and knowledge management activities by creating and revising effective systems and procedural documentation and artifacts


Position Description Title: Business Systems Analyst Reports to: Assistant Vice President, Operations Support


**Qualifications and Skills**


To be successful in this position, the individual must be able to perform each essential function. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required for this position.


**Education and Experience**


* 4-year college degree preferred


* PMP certification preferred


* Basic knowledge of SQL and ability to work in low code environment


* At least 5 years of previous similar work experience in IT, project management, or other related fields preferred


**Competencies**


**Universal:**


* Effective Communication
* Customer Orientation
* Building Collaborative Relationships
* Personal Credibility
* Technical Expertise

**Role Competencies:**


* Persuasive Communication
* Strong Analytical Thinking
* Diagnostic Information Gathering
* Growth Mindset
* Curiosity
* Initiative
* Fostering Innovation
* Managing Change
* Results Orientation
* Self Confidence

**$80,000/year - $100,000/year (bi-weekly pay).**


* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.


* 401k retirement plan.


* 10 paid holidays.


* Vacation and sick time.

title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst, Collaboration Technology
description:
**About Pinterest**:



Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.



Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. As you read through the expectations of the position, consider how your skills and experiences may complement the responsibilities of the role. We encourage you to think through your relevant and transferable skills from prior experiences.


*Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that's uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our* *PinFlex* *landing page to learn more.*


Are you passionate about employee experience and designing impactful solutions for employees? Come join the IT Employee Experience team at Pinterest where we have the responsibility for creating the future of our employee experience. In this role, you'll be at the center of building a team that will implement the tools and practices that help us achieve this vision.


**What you'll do:**


* Work cross-functionally with a broad set of business partners to design, implement, and maintain systems (people, process, and tools) to free our Pinterest employees and business teams from repetitive, tedious tasks
* Provide inputs and consultation to product owners to inform Collaboration and Productivity Tools roadmaps
* Plan and implement various Collaboration & Productivity technology enablement initiatives within IT Employee Experience team (Intranet, Enterprise Search, People Directory)
* Collaborate with a team of technology experts to produce user stories, acceptance criteria, functional designs, specifications, prototypes, and proofs-of-concept for new and enhanced functionality
* Understand and influence business process gaps via problem framing and applications solutioning
* Conduct Solution Reviews with project teams prior to design and development activities and ensure solution aligned with business requirements
* Work with executives, leaders, and teams to identify problems, design solutions, and lead projects to completion ensuring activities achieve intended outcomes (success criteria, ROI)


**What we're looking for:**


* 5+ years experience with technology initiatives (product management, consulting, etc)
* Experience with Collaboration & Productivity tools (Intranet, Google Workspace, slack)
* Experience managing large technology initiatives that are complex and cross-functional
* Ability to manage through ambiguity, build alignment, and create buy-in with cross-functional teams
* Ability to translate business goals into technology/product strategies and roadmaps
* Techno-functional aptitude to collaborate quickly and effectively with business and technology leaders
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and program management skills
* Ability to communicate in a clear and concise professional manner, tailored to the appropriate audience; including both verbal and written communications
* Experience performing detailed gap analysis, and preparing as-is & to-be process documentation
* Demonstrated ability to take ownership of work, work autonomously with minimal oversight, and be proactive with communications and task prioritization

  


**Relocation Statement:**


* This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model.

  



#LI-REMOTE



#LI-DM57


At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.


*Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found* *here**.*

**US based applicants only**


$95,200—$196,000 USD**Our Commitment to Diversity:**



Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic under federal, state, or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require an accommodation during the job application process, please notify accessibility@pinterest.com for support.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Publishing Operations, Penguin Random House (Open to Remote)
description:
**Senior Business Systems Analyst, Publishing Operations, Penguin Random House (Open to Remote)**


Penguin Random House (PRH), the world’s largest trade book publisher, is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to join the 9-member Publishing Operations Systems team, which supports the core processes used by PRH employees across all departments, including Managing Editorial, Production, Inventory, Marketing, Publicity, Design, Sales, IT, Customer Service, and Fulfillment.

  

Penguin Random House is home to genre-defining children’s literature, from *Dragons Love Tacos* to *The Phantom Tollbooth*; best-in-class storytellers including Margaret Atwood, Tommy Orange, Celeste Ng, and Jasmine Guillory; and culture-shaping works such as *Becoming* by Michelle Obama and *Daisy Jones & the Six* by Taylor Jenkins Reid.

  

The role includes requirements gathering, data analysis, project management, user support, and documentation. This is a great opportunity for someone with SAP consulting experience who enjoys complex problem-solving.

  



The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SAP MM and PP modules, SAP implementation and customization, and large data set manipulation. This is a business analyst position and does not require coding. We are looking for a candidate who can multitask, remain motivated and inquisitive, communicate clearly, and is an active member of a collaborative team.

  



***For consideration, please apply using our ATS system and include your*** ***cover letter*** ***and*** ***resume.***

 **The Role:**

* Analyze business requirements and design solutions to improve business processes, particularly in the areas of SAP MM/PP modules
* Gather and manipulate large data sets to derive insights and drive business decisions
* Effectively manage complex, multi-system projects, with diverse stakeholder groups
* Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that business requirements are understood and solutions meet business needs
* Adapt to changing needs of the business
* Conduct functional and technical analysis, create system design documentation, and perform configuration changes in a highly customized SAP system
* Develop and execute test plans to ensure that solutions are thoroughly tested and meet functional and technical requirements

  



**The Essentials:**

* 7+ years of experience in business systems analysis or related fields **(this is not a finance position)**
* 3+ years of SAP analyst experience required
	+ SAP MM/PP is a plus
* Advanced Excel required (ability to build pivot tables, vlookups, create compound and complex formulas, data validation)
* Analytical, data-driven approach; logical thinker with ability to articulate meaningful conclusions found in the data
* Experience in designing and implementing solutions to optimize business processes
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with stakeholders across different departments and levels of the organization
* Ability to effectively prioritize work across multiple projects, working with supervisor as needed
* Ability to thrive either while working independently or in a team environment

***The salary range for this position is $95K-100K. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.***


Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The salary range listed is specific to each particular open position and takes into account various factors including the specifics of the individual role, and candidate's relevant experience and qualifications.

  

Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance & generous paid time off.

  

Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 300 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.<http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/>  

  

Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

 **Company:** Penguin Random House LLC

**Country:** United States of America

**State/Region:** New York

**City:** New York

**Postal Code:** 10019

**Job ID:** 267394

title: Business Systems Analyst Associate
description:
**Job Overview:**


Graham Technologies (GTECH) seeks a Business Analyst, to assists in formulating and defining systems scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with a basic understanding of business systems and industry requirements. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, and revising existing system logic difficulties as necessary under direction of experienced Business System Analysts. Competent to consider most business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.

**You will be happy to know that this a remote role with a preference for candidates based in Dayton, OH or the DC area. Occasional travel may be required for team meetings and training. The role requires collaboration with teams across different departments and locations.**

**Responsibilities:**

* Analyze business processes and requirements, identifying opportunities for improvement.
* Translate business needs into system requirements, working closely with the Appian development team to ensure they understand and can meet these requirements.
* Assist in the application development and rationalization process, ensuring optimal configuration and use of Appian application.
* Collaborate with refactoring and modernization teams to ensure Appian applications are up to date and efficient.
* Understand legacy systems such as SAMIS and CMCS, and ensure that their capabilities and constraints are factored into Appian application development.
* Ensure information assurance and quality assurance in all Appian application.

**Competencies:**

* Strong knowledge of business process analysis, application development, and system administration.
* Familiarity with Appian software and its application within a business context.
* Understanding of legacy systems such as SAMIS and CMCS- - NATURAL, COBOL, ADABAS, FOCUS.
* Experience with refactoring and modernization efforts.
* Ability to work in a cross-functional team.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years consulting and/or directly relevant industry experience. • AA or 2yr Tech School w/2+ years
* US citizen with the ability to pass a government background check.
* Proven experience as a business analyst, specifically within Appian development.
* Experience with refactoring and modernization efforts.
* Knowledge of and experience with legacy systems such as SAMIS and CMCS - - NATURAL, COBOL, ADABAS, FOCUS.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master's degree in a relevant field

**Compensation:**


At GTech, we believe in treating every person the way we want to be treated - fairly. Our compensation package ensures everyone at GTech is given equal pay for equal work - regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, age, nationality, or even negotiation skills!


Most IT companies can probably offer many of the same services, but what sets us apart from the others is truly our people! We care about our employees and show it often with sincere appreciation and acknowledgment of not only the final work products but also the little steps taken along the way! In addition, our generous benefits package helps support our team members in living well and prospering.


Here are just a few highlights:

* Four Week's Accrued PTO First Year
* Ten Paid Federal Holidays
* Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* 401(k) Plan with Annual Employer Contributions
* Flexible Schedules
* Reimbursements for Continued Education and Training

**Why Graham Technologies?**


Our Core Values say it all!

* Value our Customers
* Care about our Employees
* Passionate about Innovation
* Believe in a Strong Work Ethic
* Rely on Teamwork
* Integrity Matters


Founded in 2007, GTech is a consulting services firm zealous about providing the best solutions to address our client's needs and maximize the value of their investments. One of the ways we do this is by providing exceptional employees for our clients - whose range of expertise expands the entire IT industry! We've cultivated a family of individuals where integrity, commitment, and reliability are etched into the heart of our delivery teams.


In addition, we are equally zealous about caring for our employees - the lifeblood of our business! We've purposefully created a culture that is friendly, family-oriented, and all-inclusive. Our team members are encouraged to "have a life," both in and out of the office, through flexible schedules (where available), continuing education, and support to pursue their passions!

title: IT Business Analyst
description: -Responsibilities: -Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with key stakeholders, including executives, sales teams, and end-users, to understand and document business requirements for the new workspace and order entry process. -Process Analysis: Analyze and evaluate existing business processes related to letters of medical necessity and order entry to identify areas for improvement and optimization. -Solution Scoping: Work closely with the executive team to define the scope of the new workspace and order entry process enhancements. -Third-Party Collaboration: Liaise with third-party application development/design team to communicate business requirements and collaborate on the creation of an initial proof of concept. -Documentation: Prepare comprehensive and clear documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and process flows, to guide the development team. -Stakeholder Communication: Facilitate communication between business stakeholders and the development team, ensuring a common understanding of requirements and expectations.

title: Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
We're seeking a Data Analyst with a passion for diving deep into data and a knack for uncovering insights. This role is ideal for someone who combines a passion for data with an interest in cybersecurity. You will play a crucial role in deciphering the data derived from penetration tests, using your SQL expertise to extract, analyze, and interpret information that will inform and enhance our partners' cybersecurity strategies.

**Responsibilities:**

* Write SQL queries to analyze and interpret penetration test data
* Data cleansing & preparation of large datasets
* Develop and maintain data models such as data tables, relationships, and data dictionaries
* Delve into large datasets to discover trends and patterns, providing actionable insights that influence cybersecurity strategies
* Continuously monitor and enhance SQL query performance and database efficiency
* Create comprehensive reports to effectively communicate findings to various stakeholders

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Science, or a related discipline
* Demonstrable expertise in SQL, with a strong understanding of relational database management systems
* Proficiency with Python and Excel
* Ability to articulate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring the highest levels of data accuracy and integrity
* Excellent teamwork skills, capable of working effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional environment

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience working with cloud-based services such as Azure or AWS
* Familiarity with any modern programming language (C#, TypeScript, PHP, Rust, GO, etc.)
* Proficiency with data reporting tools like Tableau or Power BI
* Familiarity with cybersecurity concepts such as red teaming, security research or threat intelligence

**Yep, this is a full-time gig with benefits.**

* Healthcare—Health, Dental and Vision (we cover all premiums)
* 401K (with employer match)
* Flexible schedule and paid time off
* Completely remote positions (we reconnect in person quarterly for a strategic offsite team-building meeting, which always includes some crazy adventure!)

We are revolutionizing the way businesses think about cybersecurity. You are probably asking yourself "what does 'revolutionize' mean?" Sounds like a buzz word doesn’t it. Let's define revolutionize: To make it 31 times better. We are making cybersecurity 31 times better for businesses.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* Describe one development project you made better. What was one thing you did to make it better?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Big data: 6 years (Required)
* SQL: 6 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Business Analyst Manager - Remote
description:
Paradigm is an accountable specialty care management organization focused on improving the lives of people with complex injuries and diagnoses. The company has been a pioneer in value-based care since 1991 and has an exceptional track record of generating the very best outcomes for patients, payers, and providers. Deep clinical expertise is the foundation for every part of Paradigm’s business: risk-based clinical solutions, case management, specialty networks, home health, shared decision support, and payment integrity programs.
  
  

We are seeking a full-time, remote IT Business Analyst Manager. This position will plan, coordinate, and supervise all activities of the Business Systems Analysis department which includes analysis of user requirements, procedures, systems analysis, and problem solving to automate processing or improve existing computer systems. The manager is responsible for Paradigm applications serving as the primary IT owner and is responsible for all features and functions within the applications, as well as complete logical design, functional specifications, system documentation and quality testing as needed. The manager will supervise the department of systems and business analysts in support of the applications, and projects. The manager also ensures application integration with other internal and external applications.
  
  

The manager holds accountability for leading, delegating and facilitating requirements elicitation sessions among business and technical users, writing business and technical requirements and specifications, providing functional/conceptual/logical design documents, building applicable business case models, supporting the preparation of UAT scenarios and facilitating UAT testing.
  
  

The Manager works closely with the Project Manager(s) to follow project plans, convey accurate project status, and identify issues and risks. The Manager may be assigned to coordinate projects from development through implementation, working with their organization’s IT workers, as well as clients, vendors, and consultants.
  
  

The department manager ensures the team prepares application’s workflow charts and diagrams to specify in detail, the operations to be performed by computer programs and the operations to be performed by personnel in system. This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, use cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. The manager role is also responsible for directing the department team members in generating and compiling reports based on their findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues.
  
  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Lead requirements gathering (elicitation, documentation, and management)
* Lead Systems Analysis (Functional specifications, Data Models, Workflow Analysis)
* Facilitate project customer meetings.
* Extract and analyze business needs, act as a subject matter expert when appropriate.
* Explain/document complex technical design in such a way that a business owner can understand.
* Translate business needs into system design (usage cases, process flow diagrams, narrative descriptions, data models)
* Management of system integrations as this role has full responsibility for the complete software development lifecycle.
* Perform analytical roles on all phases of a major technology project or multiple projects of medium to large size.
* Researches and advises on alternative solutions to critical/major business problems.
* Provide estimation on level of effort for business analysis and high-level development and quality assurance efforts.
* Prepares project execution plans, manages and assesses project risk.
* Identifies and engages appropriate technical and business resources needed for successful project execution.
* Leads regular project reviews with customers and stakeholders.
* Document "Lessons Learned"
* Perform system test planning and execution.
* Develop and deliver training materials and provide instruction when necessary. Act as project Subject Matter Expert for training development
* Enforce and adhere to organizational processes and standards. Experience using formal software development methodologies MSF.
* Determining and documenting customer business requirements through formal Business Analysis processes. This task involves planning, designing, and developing efficient business, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments.
* Business requirements comprehensively documented within system, functional and technical specifications by writing detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer program. Analyze and reviews existing computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within existing system. Studies existing information processing systems to evaluate effectiveness and develops new systems to improve production or workflow as required.
* Help evaluate the impact of corporate initiatives, goals, and vision upon existing application modules; recommends ways to improve or best utilize corporate information to support actualization of corporate objectives based from understanding of current business process.
* Analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing computer system. Confers with personnel of organizational units involved to analyze current operational procedures, identify problems, and learn specific input and output requirements, such as forms of data input, how data is to be summarized, and formats for reports.
* Provide functional/conceptual/logical design documents/data models, building applicable business case models, supporting the preparation of the UAT scenarios and facilitate UAT testing with documentation and/or presentation(s).
* Ensures continuous user involvement in the analysis, development, and implementation process of new applications, enhancements, fixes through organization of cross-functional meetings and working with the Project Manager to follow project plans, convey accurate project status, and identify issues and risks. Acquires end user sign off of scope requirements. Files documented results of analysis with project documentation.
* Support the operations of the Production Support and IT Operations department's systems, including implementation, troubleshooting, maintenance, and support of existing applications. Assists developers to prepare complex datasets or reports which require advanced query or complex business process.
* Create and maintain documentation on the system/applications used by the department. Provide inputs in development of conversion and software implementation project plans on assigned projects. Works with developer to coordinate completion of systems change control requests and schedules for movement of application across regions (Development to Acceptance to Production). Obtains (or works with PM as assigned) approvals of project documentation and implementation plan. Files with project documentation.
* Coordinate projects from development through implementation, working with their organization’s IT workers, as well as clients, vendors, and consultants.
* Assist managers by providing solutions input in response to the operational and strategic needs of the Production Support department. May research, investigate and make recommendations on new solutions or replacement systems/applications.
* Directs or assists in the development of new or revised training materials, and training schedule. Assures all affected functional areas are included and informed. Trains or assists in the training of IT and user personnel in the conversion, implementation or providing overview of the developed or purchased software.
* May assist the software developers in resolution of work problems related to flow charts, project specifications, or programming. May provide assistance to UI development where rules, formatting and display properties can be set in the design time using existing development tool.
* Work with the DBA’s to provide business analysis on troubleshooting of data-related production issues, test and deploy approved solution in accordance with existing release management process.
* May work with end users and other ITS personnel to evaluate packaged software. May represent Paradigm at vendor focus or user group meetings. May serve as contact point for technical issues between vendor and Paradigm or with business users within the company.
* Develops and delivers communications and awareness plan and activities to support the promotion and use of supported applications. Manages and executes deployment/support plan and activities.
* Creates and delivers curriculum and materials necessary to train the business leads, help desk resources and application users that will use and support the application.
* When applicable, manages and responds to user requests for administration and feature specific items related to the supported application.
* Other duties as assigned.


**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Mentor, train, and supervise team members directly and indirectly, review their work and provide effective constructive feedback.
* Ensure all team members understand, are trained in, and comply with Paradigm’s security requirements and policies.
* Ensure all team members have the minimum level of IT system access required to effectively complete their Paradigm responsibilities.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* The manager will be responsible for the successful facilitation and documentation of the business and functional requirements and will work closely with the business user community, IT development staff, systems manager and Systems Architect to ensure clarity of business and functional requirements. The manager will also be responsible for documenting and/or formulating the requirements during the definition and/or prototyping phase of the project, as well as the development of functional test scripts. The Manager will be required to create and manage technical project plans and schedules to deliver the identified requirements and software upgrades to the assigned project. Ux, UML and ER modeling. Information and Systems Architecture Design. Extensive knowledge with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of complicated tasks. Will lead and direct the work of others. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. May design, encode, test and debug programs or user defined modifications.
* Education - College degree, preferably a B.S. in Engineering, Computer Science or a degree with Clinical focus from an accredited college or university or equivalent experience in programming in a distributed computing environment or clinical/healthcare experience
* Experience - Ten (10) or more years of work experience in business or systems analysis within IT development field with five (5) of those years in the healthcare industry; OR any combination of academic education, professional training, or work experience which demonstrates the ability to perform the duties of the position. 6-8 years in the IT industry facilitating business and functional requirements of large, complex projects across multiple business units. Expert with all aspects of Microsoft Office products. Two (2) or more years of project management background.
* Required non-technical proficiencies and knowledge - Critical skills include excellent interviewing, facilitation, organization, project management, analytical and problem solving, mentoring and strong verbal communications and documentation writing abilities; Staff management including performance evaluations, hiring and terminations; Strong customer service skills and prior experience supporting internal customers; Strong presentation skills and the ability to provide end-user training when needed; Ability to make judgments, decisions and suggestions for procedural improvements; Ability to handle fast-paced work flow and multi-task; Flexible to meet changing needs and multiple tasks; Excellent follow-through skills with strong attention to detail; Strong ability to develop, understand and translate detailed requirements documentation from business client requirements; Adaptive and open to frequent changes in work environment and prioritization; Able to manage multiple competing deadlines; Efficiently able to work independently and as part of a team; Contributes in defining IT development practices and standards
* Required technical proficiencies/knowledge – Collaborates with Systems Architect in designing solution implementations. Knowledgeable designer of Intranet and/or web-based systems. Knowledgeable user of MS project and intranet concepts. Strong experience with client/server databases and reporting tools; Enhanced knowledge of database structure and design; Thorough understanding of Software Development Life Cycle and change management; Expert with all aspects of Microsoft Office and other Microsoft products. Ability to understand and convert business requirements into technical specifications; Strong interface knowledge; Strong knowledge of Internet formats and languages; Enhanced knowledge of software quality assurance methodology and practice; understanding of systems and applications with the ability to learn managed healthcare systems, business analysis and problem solving.
* Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communications.
* Ability to work well as a manager role in a team environment and coach, guide and direct as appropriate.
* Customer focus, results orientation, and business sense
* Energy, creativity, flexibility and self-motivated
* Technology appropriate (MS Office, Project, SharePoint, Visio, .Net, DB, etc.)
* Strong relational data model concepts knowledge and logical data modeling
* Intermediate level understanding of SQL language
* Healthcare and insurance domain knowledge
* Project management background


Paradigm believes that fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace is central to our mission of helping more people and transforming lives. We’re striving to build a culture that better reflects the society we live in and empowers our team to deliver the highest levels of compassion and care to those we serve. For us, achieving this goal requires a workforce that respectfully embraces differences and commits to positive change, creating an environment where everyone is able to bring their whole self to work.
  
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Business Analyst**
Remote

Analyzes information technology (IT) requirements in business processes, through requirements elicitation, solutions identification, risk analysis and collaboration across (IT) teams. Applies advanced consulting skills and/or extensive technical expertise; full industry knowledge. Develops innovative solutions to complex problems. Works without considerable direction; mentors and may supervise team members. Bachelors degree and 5+ years directly related experience or Masters degree and 3+ years directly related experience. Years of experience may be accepted in lieu of degree for certain roles. Certifications may be accepted in lieu of a degree for certain technical roles.

* Experience with analyzing and designing information systems and software

title: IT Business Analyst - NextGen Subject Matter Expert
description:
EyeCare Partners is the nation's leading provider of clinically integrated eye care. Our national network of over 300 ophthalmologists and 700 optometrists provides a lifetime of care to our patients with a mission to enhance vision, advance eye care and improve lives. Based in St. Louis, Missouri, over 650 ECP-affiliated practice locations provide care in 18 states and 80 markets, providing services that span the eye care continuum. For more information, visit www.eyecare-partners.com.

**The Role:**



The IT Business Analyst is responsible for the support of ophthalmology applications, and the implementation and optimization of the practice management and electronic medical record system. Under the direction of leadership, they are responsible for integrating, documenting and supporting the PMS and EMR system through various phases of project implementations. They must understand workflow and interdependencies with medical practice management and electronic health record systems and will participate in future upgrades, internal medical practice communications and training curricula development.


**Essential Responsibilities**


* Identifies areas of common practice and implements opportunities for standardization.


* Works with end users and clinical network groups to encourage maximum usage of applications.


* Demonstrates advanced knowledge of electronic health record applications/system(s).


* Coordinates application enhancements by identifying needs, analyzing benefits, identifying process changes and the impact of enhancements within the parameters of governance standards.


* Supports legacy clinical systems and other information system applications as needed.


* Supports end users across the system for application support and optimization.


* Assists with the development of test scripts and plans.


* Assists with the development of training content and appropriate training data.


* Participates in configuring/maintaining all necessary documentation and other components/activities that impact governance and regulatory requirements.


* Ensures that data interfacing into applications meets business and clinical needs – both for ongoing interfaces and one-time data conversions.


* Works with other Ophthalmology clinical applications to identify ways in which those applications can support workflow and configure/build the application accordingly.


* Analyzes users' jobs in order to make recommendations regarding application security.


* Understands the databases required for implementation/maintenance of modules.


* Creates positive change management and communication with end users to ensure their acceptance of the applications.

  


**Other Skills and Abilities**


* Must be a team player capable of working in a diverse workforce


* Excellent communication skills


**Education and/or Experience**



Bachelor's degree in IT, healthcare, finance, or related field


* At least 2 years of experience with the healthcare/NexGen, IT, or business field


* At least 2 years of experience with SQL



Experience with PMS and EMR is required


* Must have clinical or operational knowledge of workflows and interdependencies with the electronic health record and practice management software.


* Possesses a solid knowledge of information technology and information systems.


* Basic project management skills (ability to lead meetings, prioritize, resolve conflicts, maintain issues list, and execute to project plan).


* Strong communication and follow-up skills.


* Strong analytical skills and detail orientated.


* Detailed understanding of workflows and system configuration.


* Strong organizational skills.


* Detail oriented individual with the ability to gather information in order to fully understand the needs of the clinical users.


* Demonstrates/develops an expert knowledge of clinical applications, systems and functional requirements.


* Demonstrates an understanding of business process flow and the ability to facilitate process improvement.


* Demonstrates the ability to translate technical information into terminology understood at all levels of users, both verbally and in writing.


* Demonstrates organizational ability to prioritize assignments, meet deadlines and handle simultaneous projects.


* Demonstrates ability to work with minimal supervision and maintain composure under pressure.

title: IT Business Services Systems Analyst (Remote)
company: Berkshire Farm Center & Services for Youth
description:
**Join Our Mission**



The Business Services Systems Analyst will actively collaborate with business units, clinical staff, and technical teams to develop, customize, and optimize the utilization of the Netsmart MyEVOLV platform in alignment with the organization’s operational and clinical objectives. This individual will be instrumental in translating user requirements and issues into actionable specifications and solutions, ensuring seamless functionality and compliance with cybersecurity risk management policies, the NIST framework, and HIPAA regulations. By generating and maintaining custom reports and ensuring effective communication between all stakeholders, the analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting data-driven decision-making and enhancing the delivery of youth services. Through continuous professional development, they will ensure that the agency remains at the forefront of technological advancements in Business Intelligence and healthcare service delivery.


**Job Responsibilities**


* Work with business units to create specifications documents for reports, system enhancements, and other information services technology projects.
* Liaison between business users, technical personnel, and vendors.
* Client services resolution through reviews, analysis, escalation, and documenting issues for assigned business services.
* Create business requirements documents.
* Assess business processes to find business process improvement activities.
* Write process documents for business area end users.
* Document technical systems and processes.
* Assess proposed technical solutions for conformance to specifications and business needs.
* Create test cases relevant to technical solutions.
* Assess results of test cases and track identified defects with technical personnel
* Customize, troubleshoot, and optimize the Netsmart MyEVOLV platform based on user input and business requirements.
* Generate and maintain custom reports within the MyEVOLV system to support clinical operations and decision-making.
* Collaborate closely with clinical staff to understand and support their data and reporting needs.
* Maintain and ensure compliance with HIPAA and NIST framework, especially in the customization and usage of the Netsmart MyEVOLV platform.
* Create clear, concise, and comprehensive technical documentation to ensure smooth operations and compliance.
* Actively pursue professional growth opportunities and certifications in Netsmart MyEVOLV, Business Intelligence, and other relevant technologies.
* Effective Communication Skills; Strong organizational skills.
* Demonstrates strong analytical problem-solving ability.
* Demonstrated ability to understand and support clinical work and healthcare delivery.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft 365.

  


**Job Requirements**


* Bachelor's degree plus three [3] three or more years working in a business analyst role or managing/coordinating information technology projects.
+ Bachelor’s degree requirement may be waived if for candidates with 6+ years in a related role.
+ Bachelor’s degree requirement may be waived for candidates with relevant industry certifications such as Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA), or Project Management Professional (PMP)

* Strong preference will be given to candidates with prior experience with Netsmart MyEVOLV
* Strong preference will be given to candidates with prior experience working for a Youth Services organization.
* The preferred candidate will have experience with SQL queries and creating business intelligence dashboards and reports with Microsoft PowerBI
* Experience evaluating or authoring technical specifications or requirements documents.
* Actively pursue professional growth opportunities and certifications in Technology.

  


**Equal Opportunity Employer**



Berkshire Farm Center & Services for Youth is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, creed, color, national origin, sexual orientation, military status, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, disability, marital status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.



We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where diversity is valued and recognized as a source of strength and enrichment. We seek to attract talented people from a diverse range of backgrounds and cultures.



As a federal contractor, Berkshire Farm Center & Services for Youth will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Business Analyst -- Fully Remote
description:
Role is Predominantly Remote. Travel is paid for and project dependent.


We are one of the leading minority-owned management consulting firms in the nation. We have worked closely with blue-chip organizations across the public and private sector including local municipalities and state and federal agencies. Our services center around, but are not limited to, capital program development and delivery, transactional advisory services, cross departmental organizational change, IT transformation, and organizational alignment.


Our senior advisers bring a wealth of experience across all sectors. We focus on collaboration with our Clients to architect creative and effective solutions to deliver transformational programs!


**Responsibilities of this role:**

* Set up and facilitate meetings with Stakeholders to understand business processes, pain points, and project requirements
* Understand program needs and document clear and detailed business requirements, including the creation of process flows
* Acts as a translator between the stakeholder and other team members to help the business team understand the client’s vision
* Operate in both an Agile and traditional Waterfall environments while actively supporting deliverable creation and delivery
* Routinely record and send out meeting minutes, decisions, and action items to team members

**Qualifications**

* BA or BS is required
* 2+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or relevant professional experience in a variety of backgrounds and industries
* Experience working in and utilizing various business analysis techniques with Agile and or traditional project management principles
* Experience working as part of a multi-function project team, including interacting and following-up with multiple stakeholders including but not limited to program leaders, SMEs, process owners, IT staff, etc.

**Skills Required:**

* Strong analytical, planning, and organization skills
* Demonstrates strong time management skills and is able to manage competing demands
* Excellent presentation and written communication skills with experience interacting at all levels including at the executive level
* Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using project management tools such as PowerPoint, Excel, Microsoft Project, Visio, and all Office tools
* Ability to travel for work as needed
* Willingness to learn new skills and dedicated to self-growth

title: Business Analyst
description:
**About GemGem:** GemGem is a leading C2C online jewelry marketplace dedicated to providing a seamless and enjoyable shopping experience for jewelry enthusiasts worldwide. With a focus on innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction, GemGem offers a wide range of exquisite jewelry pieces sourced from trusted sellers around the globe.



**Job Description:** GemGem is seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. The Business Analyst will play a critical role in understanding the business needs and objectives of the organization, translating them into actionable insights, and driving strategic initiatives to support business growth and optimization.
**Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, requirements, and opportunities for improvement.
* Conduct thorough analysis of market trends, customer behavior, and competitor landscape to inform strategic decision-making.
* Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and metrics to monitor key performance indicators and track business performance.
* Analyze data to identify opportunities for optimization and improvement across various business functions, including sales, marketing, operations, and customer service.
* Work closely with stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and success criteria, and ensure alignment with business goals.
* Facilitate workshops, meetings, and discussions to gather requirements, clarify business needs, and prioritize initiatives.
* Provide insights and recommendations to support decision-making, resource allocation, and strategic planning.
* Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure that business requirements are accurately translated into IT solutions.
* Support the implementation and adoption of new processes, systems, and technologies, and provide training and support to end-users as needed.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, preferably in the e-commerce or retail industry.
* Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented mindset with a passion for problem-solving and continuous improvement.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience with Agile methodologies and project management tools is a plus.


**Why Join GemGem:**


* Opportunity to work in a fast-growing startup environment with a culture of innovation and collaboration.
* Chance to make a real impact and contribute to the success of an exciting and dynamic online marketplace.
* Competitive compensation package, including salary, benefits, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.


If you’re ready to embark on an exciting journey in the world of e-commerce and jewelry,

title: Technical Analyst
description:
**Req ID:** 61731
  
**Department:** Data & Marketing Data, Analytics & Automation
  
**Division:** New Zealand
  
**Location:** Bengaluru
  
About the role
  
  

**Job Title:** Tech Business Analyst
  
  

Job Location - Manyata Tech Park, Bangalore
  
  

Job Type - FTE Permanent, 4.4
  
  

The Technical Business Analyst is a key role within the Customer Remediation team that focusses on making things right when multiple customers are impacted by systemic issues such as errors in pricing, disclosure, or compliance. As Remediation Technical Business Analyst, you will work on our most complex cases. You will work across portfolio of cases of varying sizes and timelines, and will juggle items such as:
  
  

Work with product stakeholders and data analysts, applying an understanding of organisational context to analyse and synthesise information, and to translate business requirements into technical requirements.
  
  

Elicit, document and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycle.
  
  

Perform testing, process validation, and other business analysis activities.
  
  

Plan and co-ordinate project implementation using approved documentation & tracking tools.
  
  

BA responsibilities such as developing registers of key decisions impacting case scoping and calculations, and how these are implemented in data analysis.
  
  

Executing remediation plans that could include customer and staff communication and compensation payments.
  
  

What will your day look like
  
  

Ensure that assigned business analysis activities are conducted efficiently and within agreed timeframes and ensure that the outputs and benefits are clear.
  
  

Develop requirements that are fit for purpose and accurate, display an understanding of the financial implications to the project or program, and manage the requirements throughout the life of the project.
  
  

Assist the data lead in the timely delivery of the project.
  
  

Work efficiently with the data team to elicit requirements that are fit for purpose, engaging internal and/or external stakeholders where appropriate.
  
  

Maintain relationships with internal and/or external stakeholders and communicate requirements clearly and concisely.
  
  

Validate requirements with the project and data team to ensure that proposed solutions meet these requirements.
  
  

Develop presentations and documentation to communicate insights & recommendations in a compelling manner, and present regular project updates to the wider team.
  
  

Display knowledge of business analysis processes, demonstrate ability to document and communicate requirements effectively, and contribute to the improvement of business analysis processes and performance.
  
  

Understand SAS and SQL script. Test and validate them against the functional/technical requirements.
  
  

Adhere to established ANZ policy and procedures and display an understanding of project & program practices and governance.
  
  

Adhere to change control processes and traceability throughout the life of the project/task in accordance with established document management methods.
  
  

Participate in the continuous improvement of Customer Resolution methodologies and governance processes and assist in implementing any process improvements.
  
  

Maintain ANZ Values
  
  

What will you bring?
  
  

4-6 years business analysis experience and/or related technical experience in SAS/SQL.
  
  

Can appreciate difficult problems and work autonomously on tasks with a medium complexity, can work collaboratively as part of a team and clearly articulate & present consolidated findings.
  
  

Detailed knowledge of business analysis tasks, experience in elicitation techniques and competent in requirements gathering skills.
  
  

Solid understanding of data development lifecycles, disciplines, and procedures.
  
  

Communicate effectively with product stakeholders to gather business requirements, understand business rules and work with data team to implement them.
  
  

Good knowledge of data sourcing and experience in data-intensive projects.
  
  

Demonstrated knowledge and experience in working on mid to large sized projects.
  
  

2+ years of hands-on experience in SQL is must.
  
  

Experience in SAS will be an advantage.
  
  

Experience in Agile/ Scrum methodologies will be an advantage.
  
  

So, why join us?
  
  

There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers. And that’s big.
  
  

But it’s not just our customers who will feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future.
  
  

We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate to provide all our people:
  
  

Health and wellbeing programs
  
  

Discounts on selected products and services (from ANZ and beyond)
  
  

Flexible working arrangements, lifestyle leave and career breaks
  
  

You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.
  
  

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.careers.anz.com.
  
  

Job Posting End Date
  
  

, 11.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)

title: Data Analyst
description:
Introduction
We are seeking for 4+years highly skilled and dynamic Dynamic Analyst to join our forward-thinking data engineering team. In this pivotal role, you will be at the heart of our data-driven initiatives, leveraging the power of Azure Databricks to drive business transformation and insights. As a key member of our team, you will bridge the gap between complex data solutions and business needs, ensuring that our data engineering projects are aligned with our strategic goals and deliver tangible value.
As our ideal candidate, you will bring a strong blend of analytical skills, technical knowledge, and a deep understanding of data engineering concepts within the Azure Databricks ecosystem. Your expertise will be crucial in shaping the direction of our data projects, from conceptualization to implementation, ensuring they not only meet but exceed our business objectives. Your role will involve collaborating closely with data scientists, engineers, and key stakeholders, translating business needs into technical solutions that are efficient, scalable, and impactful
Responsibilities include:

* Requirement Gathering and Analysis: Collect and analyze business requirements from stakeholders. This involves understanding business objectives, challenges, and expectations from the data engineering project.
* Data Exploration and Understanding: Work with business users, data scientists and engineers to explore the data available in various systems of records (including SAP).
* Understand the nature, quality, and structure of the data to identify how it can be best used to meet business needs.
* Translating Business Needs into Technical Specifications: Convert business requirements into detailed technical specifications for data engineering team in the form of user stories in Azure DevOps. This includes defining the scope, objectives, source schemas, transformation rules, data quality rules and data consumption patterns for the data product.
* Collaboration with Data Engineering Team: Work closely with data engineers and architects to ensure that the data solutions being developed in Azure Databricks align with business requirements and are feasible within the technical framework.
* User Acceptance Testing (UAT): Define the Acceptance test criteria /plans and Coordinate and conduct UAT to validate that the data solutions meet the business requirements and perform as expected.
* Stakeholder Communication: Regularly communicate with stakeholders about the progress, challenges, and outcomes of the data engineering project.
* Keeping Abreast with Azure Databricks Updates: Stay updated with the latest features and best practices in Azure Databricks to leverage its full potential in data engineering projects.
* Feedback and Continuous Improvement: Collect feedback from users and stakeholders and incorporate it into ongoing or future projects to continuously improve data solution

Job Details
Role:


Data Analyst


Location :


Trivandrum/Chennai/Pune/Bangalore


Close Date :


16-03-2024


Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to **Careers@reflectionsinfos.com** along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details. This is to notify jobseekers that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Please note that no payment is ever sought for jobs in Reflections. We contact our candidates only through our official website or LinkedIn and all employment related mails are sent through the official HR email id. Please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarification/ alerts on this subject.

title: Technical Analyst
description:
### **General information**

**All posting locations:** Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India


**Job Function:** 15 - GBS


**Date Published:** 06-Mar-2024


**Ref #:** R-80086


### **Description & Requirements**

**REQUIREMENTS**

* 5+ years-experience in Master Data management and governance, maintaining a knowledge of product, material, customer, vendor domains. Finance knowledge is also desirable
* SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) certification is preferred
* Should have worked in at-least two Master Data Governance support project and knowledgeable global delivery model operations
* Should be Technical in Master Data Governance, in-depth working knowledge of Object-Oriented ABAP
* Should have worked on Data models (enhance data model in Flex/Re-Use mode), Rule based workflow, BRF + configuration, updating Decision tables, UIBB developments, working with BADI’s and DRFOUT framework,
* Design and setup complex ruled based workflow with dynamic routing and parallel processing in SAP Master Data Governance.
* Extensively worked on HANA search, data quality check, duplicates check and custom checks on entities using BRF+ and BADI’s.
* Configured Data Replication using SOA and IDOCS for MDG-M, MDG-BP and MDG-F and extended the SOA services and IDOCs with custom fields.
* Expertise in Debugging, Performance Tuning, and multiple Job Scheduling
* Persuasive communicator, strong facilitator with the ability to be flexible and adjust approach to each situation
* Strong overall SAP knowledge – WRICEFs, ECC, MDG on S4, Workflow, Data Services, Ariba, S4 HANA, etc
* Experience with ServiceNow and incident management protocols
* Knowledge of tools like Information Steward (BOIS), Tableau and Process Orchestration (PO) is preferred
* Innovator mindset and drive to ensure continuous improvement, strong on building SOPs

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Work/interact/liaison with internal and external resources owning incident management, development / configuration, small enhancements, and end user engagement
* Works independently and supports other technical team members
* Ability to work across multiple domains and geographies. Including, but not limited to, North America, Latin America, Europe, Russia, Middle East/Africa, Australia/New Zealand, Asia Pacific, etc.
* Work with IT & Business Leadership to resolve identified issues permanently
* Deliver technical specifications, test cases, unit testing documentation
* Collaborate with the Data Management Factory, IT Master Data Team, Data Operations and Governance to support all domain processes

**Career Experience**

* Data & Knowledge Management
* Application Management Services/Global Service Model
* Process Management
* Project Management
* Requirements Definition
* Vendor Relationship Management
* Communication Skills
* Influencing and Negotiating

  


### **About Us**


Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.



Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.


### **Why Us**


We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.



Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.



*Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes.*
